title: Mahabharata | Part 34 | Why Krishna did not attend the game of dice | HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Welcome to today's episode of the Mahabharata.
segments.summary: Introduction to the episode, recapping the previous episode and outlining the topic for the current one.

segments.key_quote: At that time Shalva promised to his friend Shishupala, that, this insult to you, I will take revenge of it.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the reason why Krishna had to leave Indraprastha and return to Dwaraka: Shalva's attack, motivated by revenge for Krishna's abduction of Rukmini.

segments.key_quote: Lord Shiva said, okay, is that all you want? Take it, take it.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates how Shalva performed austerities to please Lord Shiva and obtained an invincible airship, which he then used to attack Dwaraka.

segments.key_quote: Our whole dynasty, nobody has ever run away from the battlefield. And you have taken away me from the battlefield.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the battle between Krishna's sons, led by Pradyumna, and Shalva's army, focusing on Pradyumna's temporary defeat and subsequent return to the battlefield.

segments.key_quote: And Krishna's arrow started wreaking havoc in Shalva's army.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates Krishna's arrival in Dwaraka, his battle with Shalva, and the ultimate defeat of Shalva and his army.

segments.key_quote: Krishna immediately took his club which was called Kaumodaki. And with that he gave one blow to Dantavakra. Dantavakra fell down there itself and died on the battlefield.
segments.summary: The speaker continues the narrative with the arrival and defeat of Dantavakra and Viduratha, highlighting Krishna's role in vanquishing those opposed to him.

segments.key_quote: Krishna purposely did not intervene in that game of dice.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that while Krishna was engaged in battle in Dwaraka, the Pandavas were being cheated in the game of dice, and Krishna allowed it to happen as part of his divine plan to annihilate the demoniac kings.

segments.key_quote: Despite all these calamities in their lives, the Pandavas, not once have they complained that, O Krishna, we are your devotees. Why is this happening to us?
segments.summary: The speaker narrates Narada Muni's conversation with Krishna, highlighting the Pandavas' unwavering devotion and unconditional love for Krishna despite their suffering.

segments.key_quote: A pure devotee always, whenever he comes across any difficulty in his life, in his heart he is not suffering any difficulty. He is only experiencing the bliss of Krishna's protection.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the perspective of a pure devotee, who sees difficulties as a result of past karma and experiences Krishna's protection even in the midst of suffering, ending with a teaser for the next episode.
